Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio hit a leadoff triple in the bottom of the ninth inning, sparking a winning rally for the Brewers.
Jake Bauers turned on a 98.3 mph fastball and pulled it into right field for a walk-off single.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers manager Pat Murphy praised Bob Uecker, saying 'There is no one who epitomizes a champion the way this man does right here.'
Brewers owner Mark Attanasio talked about the risk of signing Jackson Chourio to a record-setting, eight-year, $82 million contract.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers clinched their fourth division title in the last seven years.
Bob Uecker, 90 years old, made his way down to the clubhouse from the radio booth after the game.
The game was a 2-1 win for the Brewers over the Phillies.
Others: The Brewers will have postseason tickets on sale Friday, online and in person.
Chourio's numbers since June 2 include a.306/.365/.550 slash in 359 plate appearances.
